DataElement.preferredName: Person Karnofsky Performance Status Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response to determine eligibility for clinical trial participation for questions related to the patient's Karnofsky Performance Status as outlined in the protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Karnofsky Performance Status Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to person's measure of how well a patient is able to perform ordinary tasks and carry out daily activities (Karnofsky which has scores range from 0 to 100) as an elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Property.preferredName: Karnofsky Performance Status Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Karnofsky Performance Status. A standard way of measuring the ability of cancer patients to perform ordinary tasks.  The scores range from 0 to 100, with a higher score indicating a better ability to carry out daily activities.  KPS may be used to determine a patient's prognosis, to measure changes in functioning, or to decide if a patient could be included in a clinical trial.:Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: An index designed for classifying patients 16 years of age or older by their functional impairment.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.origin: RTOG CRF:Radiation Therapy Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
